string.value:
I had some trouble getting the GotDotNet Windows Forms souce code control tool to work.  Each time I tried to go to source code control for a project an error would occur giving me the option to re-downoad the tool an re-run the tool.  The exact error was:

"Before the GotDotNet Workspaces Windows Forms control can be run, some changes must be made to the .NET Framework security settings on your computer."

Fortunately, there was also a link that described how to manually configure the security settings.  After some investigation I discovered that the problem related to the fact that Whidbey was installed.  To overcome the problem I had to follow the instructions using the .NET 2.0 Configuration Tool.  The instructions are as follows:

  1. Click Start, Control Panel and open the Administrative Tools.
  2. Start the Microsoft .NET Framework Configuration tool.
  3. Using the treeview on the left, navigate to My Computer\Runtime Security Policy\Machine\Code Groups\All_Code
  4. Start the Create Code Group Wizard by clicking 'Add a Child Code Group'
  5. Provide a code group name: GotDotNet_Workspaces
  6. Provide a code group description: Security group for GotDotNet Workspaces
  7. Provide a condition type: URL
  8. Provide a trusted URL: http://www.gotdotnet.com/community/workspaces/*
  9. Use an existing permission set: FullTrust
  10. Finish the Create Code Group Wizard and close the Microsoft .NET Framework Configuration tool.
  11. Close all Internet Explorer windows and restart your browser.
